importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating the most recent update on the incident involving Brett James' plane crash.
The date of the plane crash, which is central to the timeline of the incident and the NTSB investigation.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The geographic and temporal context of the crash location and date, which situates the event in a specific regional and historical context.

keyTakeAways: Brett James, a Grammy-winning songwriter, died in a plane crash on September 18, 2025, while attempting a visual approach to runway 7 at Franklin, North Carolina.
The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) reported that the plane entered a 'tightening spiral' prior to crashing, with no mechanical issues identified.

James had requested a visual approach, which was approved, but failed to change his radio frequency to the common traffic advisory frequency, leading to a loss of communication with air traffic control.
The plane, a Cirrus SR22T, flew over the runway and executed a left turn before descending into a spiral and crashing.

James was a prominent songwriter who collaborated with major artists such as Taylor Swift, Bon Jovi, Keith Urban, and Kenny Chesney, and his work on 'Jesus, Take the Wheel' helped launch Carrie Underwood’s career.
The incident highlights a critical issue in aviation safety: pilot communication and adherence to standard radio protocols during visual approaches.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A Grammy-winning songwriter, Brett James, died in a plane crash on September 18, 2025, while attempting a visual approach to runway 7 at Franklin, North Carolina. The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) reported that the Cirrus SR22T plane entered a 'tightening spiral' before crashing, with no mechanical issues found. James had requested a visual approach, which was approved, but failed to change his radio frequency to the common traffic advisory frequency, resulting in a loss of communication with air traffic control. The incident underscores the importance of adherence to aviation communication protocols, especially during visual approaches. James was a highly respected songwriter who collaborated with major artists such as Taylor Swift, Bon Jovi, Keith Urban, and Kenny Chesney, and his work on 'Jesus, Take the Wheel' helped launch Carrie Underwood’s career.
title: Songwriter Brett James’ plane enters a 'tightening spiral' before crashing, NTSB says
